Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Eros (Harpocrates?) standing with wings (?) protruding at the back. He leans on a pillar to his left. His long curly hair is cascading down his neck. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Traces of a white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric. Base is missing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published (Schmidt 1997, 97, no.117, pl. 41). Mid 3rd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, no.171), but in a different pose. See also parallel from Oxyrhynchus dated 1st or 2nd century AD (Bailey 2008, no.3045). Based on a common Hellenistic Greek representation of Eros (British Museum GR 1887,0414.1 thought to be produced in Myrina in the 1st century BC). Schmidt, S. 1997. Katalog der Ptolemäischen und Kaiserzeitlichen objekte aus Ägypten im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn, Munich. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.235) (Phase 3)
